text.div:
Generated Narrative: CodeSystem request-status

This case-sensitive code system http://hl7.org/fhir/request-status defines the following codes in an undefined hierarchy:

LvlCodeDisplayDefinition
1draft DraftThe request has been created but is not yet complete or ready for action.
1active ActiveThe request is in force and ready to be acted upon.
1on-hold On HoldThe request (and any implicit authorization to act) has been temporarily withdrawn but is expected to resume in the future.
1entered-in-error Entered in ErrorThis request should never have existed and should be considered 'void'. (It is possible that real-world decisions were based on it. If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "revoked" rather than "entered-in-error".).
1ended EndedThis request is no longer to be acted upon. This status does not differentiate what degree of action (if any) has already been undertaken against the request.
2  completed CompletedThe activity described by the request has been fully performed. No further activity will occur.
2  revoked RevokedThe request (and any implicit authorization to act) has been terminated prior to the known full completion of the intended actions. No further activity should occur.
1unknown UnknownThe authoring/source system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this request. Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, but the authoring/source system does not know which.

name: RequestStatus
title: RequestStatus
description: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of a request.

concept.definition: The request is in force and ready to be acted upon.
The activity described by the request has been fully performed.  No further activity will occur.
The request has been created but is not yet complete or ready for action.
This request is no longer to be acted upon. This status does not differentiate what degree of action (if any) has already been undertaken against the request.

This request should never have existed and should be considered 'void'.  (It is possible that real-world decisions were based on it.  If real-world activity has occurred, the status should be "revoked" rather than "entered-in-error".).
The request (and any implicit authorization to act) has been temporarily withdrawn but is expected to resume in the future.
The request (and any implicit authorization to act) has been terminated prior to the known full completion of the intended actions.  No further activity should occur.

The authoring/source system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this request.  Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply,  but the authoring/source system does not know which.
